author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Regional Passport Office (RPO), Chennai, will organise ‘Passport Mela’ in Passport Seva Kendra at Tambaram on Saturday.

According to a press release, the Passport Seva Kendra in Tambaram will function on Saturday and accept applications as per time slots allotted to the applicants.

Around 500 normal applicants are expected to benefit from the mela. To participate in the mela, all applicants have to log on to the official websitewww.passportindia.gov.in, register online, generate ‘ARN’ (Application Registration Number) and pay online fees and then take an appointment. Applicants participating in the mela should bring the printout of ARN with appointment details, to the PSKs along with requisite documents in originals and one set of self-attested photocopies. Applications for Tatkal and ‘PCC’ will not be accepted at the mela. Walk-ins including On-Hold and Refuse token will also not be entertained at the mela.

The appointments will be released at 2.45 p.m. on Tuesday for the mela, the release added.
title: Passport mela at Tambaram on Saturday
